p.codeblock: virtual int startScreenCapture(VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE sourceType, const ScreenCaptureConfiguration& config) = 0;
public abstract int StartScreenCapture(VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE sourceType, ScreenCaptureConfiguration config);

p.ph: This method and and all have the capability to start screen capture. The key distinction lies in:
This method and , and all have the capability to start screen capture. The key distinction lies in:

ul.li: only applies to Android and iOS, whereas this method only applies to Windows and iOS.

and only support capturing video from a single screen or window. By calling this method and specifying the sourceType parameter, you can capture multiple screen streams used for local video mixing or multi-channel publishing.
This method applies to the macOS and Windows platforms only.
If you call this method to start screen capture, Agora recommends that you call to stop the capture and avoid using .

pd.p: The type of the video source, see .

ul.li: Windows supports up to 4 screen capture video streams.
macOS supports only 1 screen capture video stream. You can only set this parameter to (2).

plentry.pd: The configuration of the captured screen. See .

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown; you need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly.
